intro: Nematanthus calycinus, commonly known as the velvetleaf strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are usually violet or purple in color and bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
